CatDescriptText: Evver Timpson, 624 Ossipee Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 12, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should well-defined courses in sex education be taught in public school system? If so, at what grade should the teaching of these courses begin?" answer reads: "I think that they should be taught, and taught early.  I think that if they are educated when they are young, they are less liable to make mistakes."
TitMainTitle: Evver Timpson wearing dark short sleeved floral dress, eyeglasses, and three strand beaded necklace, standing in front of light colored stone flecked wall, store window with shoe display on left and woman wearing dark dress with light colored polka dots, eyeglasses, and light colored hat, standing on right
